text: Clear light golden with a fluffy white head. Earthy golden German malt graininess with a little German grassiness. Crisp grassy bitterness and an easy going crisp cracker maltiness thats german, light and grainy. Not shabby.
Draft - A very clear light yellow color. Not much of a smell at all. Very dry beer, zero hops bitterness. Just a hair to sweet. A good clean and refreshing beer.

Sampled at GABF 2016 with Paul and Larry. Thanks to Fly for the heads up on these guys - enjoyed many drinks with Swift and Amos. Pours a bright, pale yellow body with fresh wispy white lacing. Nose is super clean grassy character and soft bready malt. Mouthfeel is absolutely divine for the style - super clean, crisp and sessionable with a great amount of flavor towards the backend. Nice notes of crackers, pale malt, soft spice and grass; or as Amos would put it, "LAGER BEER! LAGER BEER! LAGER BEER!"
9500th rating. Pours a clear yellow gold with medium white head that lasts. The aroma is floral, grass, lemon zest. Medium body, corn, grass, light bitterness, good.

This is a fantastic Helles. Light clear straw color, medium carbonation and finish, maintains a small blanket of head on top through the bottom of the glass. Smells like bread clove and fresh cut grass.
(En fût à la brasserie): Base céréalière délicieusement sucrée, des agrumes adéquatement timides et une finale molle et fruitée. Solide.

Austin, Tx - on tap at ABG.B Slightly hazy, medium golden pour, soft snow white head, light lacing. Aroma is bready and yeasty, pleasant. Solid grainy flavor, some honey sweetness, a bit of yeast in the back end along with some nuttiness. Crisp mouthfeel. Decent, good representation of the style.
Sample glass. Looks like a flat helles. Tastes are all on point but needs much more carbonation.

Austin Beer Garden Hell Yes is simple but enjoyable. Low aroma coming from a sparkling yellow pour with a head just too thin. Taste is a nice balance of malt and hops - surprisingly hearty flavor from such a light body beer. Hell Yes is a good regular that goes great with food.
I think I feel the hand of Swifty graced this graced this precious liquid. He knows his helles, yes. I drink, I like, I want more.
Draft - Sweet with some lemon notes. Pale yellow with a thin white head. Light lemon and citrus, touches of honey and grain. Nice and refreshing.
Clean crisp and very breast. Light hop finish and very smooth still. Very subtle yeast flavor. Good beer
Golden with a slight haze.White head. Aroma of golden malt and straw with a little gumminess. Crisp and malty with a good bite and a little sweetness and bitterness.
On tap at the brewpub. Light pour with a big white head. Aroma is a little buttery with light spice and grain. Taste is grass and more grain. Great finish.
Pour is golden with white head..Nose is musty, greman hop, spicy..Taste is spice, honey, clean, light, musty
Yellow with a white head. The aroma has some strong pale malts as well as some grass. The flavor is grassy with a lot of malt and yeast. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Solid lager.
